s.text: But since the DLC has already succeeded in defining "moderate" as the opposite of "liberal," its spin prevails.

But since the DLC has already succeeded in defining "moderate" as the opposite of "liberal," its spin prevails.
Earlier this month, the Democratic Leadership Council released a new poll purporting to show that Democratic voters support the DLC's "centrist" agenda.

The CAF has hired Stan Greenberg, one of the "liberal" consultants who helped elect Clinton in 1992 and then got the boot after the Democrats lost big in 1994.

Greenberg asks people why they voted for Clinton instead of the Republicans.

Greenberg's survey, for example, asks people who voted for Clinton to pick from a list of possible reasons why they did so.
